page.title: 15Caversham Lock
page.content: The lock is one of the smallest on the{River Thames}and this causes a bottle_neck on busy Saturdays. You do not have to pay to go through the lock as the price is included in your tax to have the boat. It takes about 10 minutes to get through the lock. The lock holds{135000 gallons}of water when full and{73000 gallons}when drained. The lock opens at{9.00 a.m. all the year round and closes at{7.00 {p.m. in the summer and 4.15 p.m. in {the winter.}The busiest time of year is June to September but it usually depends on the weather on how many boats go through the lock. The lock gates are operated by electricity. Mainly pleasure boats go through the lock. Most{foreign tourists}are from America, Germany and Australia. Near the lock is a shopping marina which sells food, diesel fuel etc for boats.
